title: Aikidō
description: A defensive martial art developed by Ueshiba Morihei between 1925 and 1969.

title: Enryākuji
description: Main monastery of the tendai sect on Mount Hiei zan near Kyōto. Founded by Tennō Kammu as the center of Tendai Buddhism. In its heyday the monastery had up to 40,000 monks and sōhei in 3000 temples on the mountain In September 1571 it was destroyed by Oda Nobunaga in the course of his campaign against ikkō ikki, Ninja and sōhei and killed most of the residents.

title: Aikuchi
description: Small Japanese dagger.

title: Ainu
description: Native people of Japan. A linguistically and racially distinct people from the Japanese who now live in small numbers (15,000 individuals) on the northern island of Hokkaidō. Their build is stocky, with light skin, strong bones, and body hair.

title: Ai sha
description: Principle of gojō goyoku based on exploiting compassion.

title: Akechi Mitsuhide
description: General of Oda Nobunaga, who betrayed him and, in the absence of his bodyguards, attacked and killed Nobunaga. His troops burned Nobunaga’s castle.

title: Akindo
description: Popular Ninja disguise in shichi hō de.

title: Ashigaru
description: Lower class of the Samurai. In peacetime they were mostly farmers in the fields. Their armament and armor were lighter and cheaper.

title: Ashikaga
description: Clan descended from the Minamoto who were the shōgune of Japan in the Ashikaga period (1338-1573).

title: Ashi kō
description: Ninja climbing foot claws, used to climb walls and walls. The counterpart for the hands is called shukō or tekagi.

title: Atemi
description: Punches and kicks against the human’s vital points and nerve centers to stun, paralyze or kill them.

title: Atemi waza
translation: Hit the body with the hand
description: Another term for hitting the vital points and nerve centers.

title: Bakufu
description: Originally the name for the shōgun encampment. Later for the seat of the shōgun military dictatorship.

title: Bakuhatsu gama
description: Ninja weapon consisting of a large sickle (kama), a two meter long chain and explosives, poison or blinding powder at the end.

title: Bansenshūkai
translation: Ten thousand rivers flow into the sea
description: A ten-part Ninja compendium written in 1676 by Fujibayashi Yasuyoshi.

title: Banzai
description: Japanese exclamation of joy or battle.

title: Bashigo
description: Also hashigo. Usually made from reeds or bamboo.

title: Bisentō
description: Japanese broad-bladed halberd.

title: Biwako
description: The largest lake in Japan (695 km²), located near the city of Kyōto. The name comes from its lute (biwa)-like shape.

title: Bō
description: Term for all Japanese staff weapons. Actually related to the roku shaku bō.

title: Bōryaku
description: Part of Japanese warfare (heihō). This included the Japanese battle formations.

title: Bō shuriken
description: Elongated, dagger-like projectiles (shuriken). Hairpins, nails, chopsticks, among others.

title: Bō ken
description: Practicing sword made of heavy wood. Also bokken or bokutō. A quite dangerous weapon.

title: Bokken
description: Also bō ken or bokutō.

title: Boku
description: Also moku.

title: Bokutō
description: Also bō ken or bokken.

title: Boshi ken
description: The target is hit with the tip of the thumb.

title: Bu
translation: The Art of War, Warriorship, Military
description: Also mu.

title: Buddha
description: Term for a person who has broken the world cycle of reincarnation. Usually Buddha means the Buddha Siddhārtha Gautama, a prince from Kapilavatsu, the founder of the world religion Buddhism. Japanese Butsu.

title: Budō
description: Term for all Japanese martial arts.

title: Budōka
description: Performer of budō.

title: Bugeisha
description: Term for the warriors (Samurai), practitioners of the martial arts. Also bujin.

title: Bujin
description: Also bugeisha.

title: Bujinkan
translation: The Hall of the Divine Warrior
description: Organization founded by Hatsumi Masaaki, brings together nine ancient warrior and Ninjutsu ryū.

title: Bujutsu
description: Term for all Samurai martial arts.

title: Buke
description: Term for noble warrior families.

title: Bushi
description: Term for the noble warriors of feudal Japan.

title: Bushidō
description: Samurai code of honor. Demanded self-discipline, self-sacrifice, and self-control.

title: Chi giri ki
description: Long staff, with chain and iron weight at the end. Weapon evolved from the flail.

title: Chikatabi
description: Ninja shoes, with a separate big toe. Great for silent running and climbing.

title: Chi kai ri
description: Strategies used by the Ninja during a war to penetrate enemy lines.

title: Chikujō jutsu
translation: The art of building a castle
description: Field fortification methods.

title: Chitsu mishi
description: Dwellers of a hostile territory working for a Ninja.

title: Chōda
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Chōkyori kyōsō
description: A Ninja running technique used to deliver messages over long distances.

title: Chūnin
description: Mid-ranking Ninja. Liaison between a clan leader (jōnin) and executive agents (genin). His strengths lay in the areas of people skills and the dressing up, because he usually established contact with the client.

title: Daimyō
description: Term for the rising landowners who fought for power in Japan during the sengoku jidai period.

title: Daisharin
description: Ninja weapon consisting of an axle and two large wheels. Was rolled into the opponent’s legs.

title: Daishō
description: Denotes the sword pair of the Samurai, katana and wakizashi.

title: Daitō
description: Term for oversized Samurai swords.

title: Daken taijutsu
translation: The art of hitting your body with your fist
description: Fighting techniques from taijutsu. Kicks, punches and blocking techniques. Distinction between koppō jutsu and koshi jutsu.

title: Dan
description: Description for the master degrees.

title: Dengyō Daishi
description: Founder of Tendai Buddhist sect and Enryakuji Monastery. Other name was Saichō.

title: Densho
description: Secret documents of a ryū that recorded the techniques and rules.

title: Dō
description: Label for the Asian worldview.

title: Dō no hi
description: Pocket warmer. A small oven into which the Ninja placed a smoldering coal. Also known as dōka.

title: Dōka
description: Bag warmers. Also dō no hi.

title: Doko no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Do sha
description: Principle of gojō goyoku based on exploiting irritability.

title: Doton jutsu
translation: The Art of Escape with Earth
description: Escape technique from goton pō, using the earth as a means of escape.

title: Edo
description: Old term for the Japanese capital, today Tōkyō.

title: Eki
description: Interrogated by coins or yarrow stalks. In Chinese I Ching.

title: Endoku ken
description: Throwing star (shuriken) that could be ignited and produced poisonous gases.

title: Engetsu
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Fudō ken
description: A fist stance found in many martial arts that represents a <q>normal</q> fist.

title: Fudōshin
description: A calm, unmoved mind.

title: Fudōza no kamae
description: Seated position in Japan, also stance in Ninjutsu.

title: Fujibayashi Nagato
description: Famous jōnin from the Iga region. Actually just a sham identity of Momochi Sandayu.

title: Fujita Seiko
description: Grandmaster of Ninjutsu. The last chief of the Kōga ryū. Died in a car accident at the age of 65 with his top three students.

title: Fukibari
description: Ninja fighting technique in which small metal needles (fukumi bari) were blown into the attacker’s face.

title: Fukiya
description: Most of the bullets were poisoned.

title: Futokoro teppō
description: Bronze pistol that was easy to conceal. Popular with the Ninja.

title: Fuma Kotarō
description: Famous jōnin Ninja with 200 minions. Specialist in guerrilla warfare.

title: Gandō
description: Lighting tool whose light source is always held perpendicular to the ground.

title: Gankō
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Gasshō no kamae
description: Ninjutsu stance (kamae). Greeting with palms together.

title: Genin
description: Lower rank of the Ninja. Executive agent who takes his orders from the chūnin. He mostly doesn’t know the jōnin. His strengths were melee combat, concealment, infiltration and sabotage.

title: Genji
description: Label for the Minamoto.

title: Geta
description: Wooden sandals with high heels, a cross or toe strap.

title: Geri
description: Also keri.

title: Gi
description: Training clothes.

title: Gikan-ryū
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Godai
description: The five elements of the universe from the Mikkyō. Earth (chi), Water (sui), Fire (ka), wind (fu) and emptiness (kū).

title: Gisō jutsu
translation: The art of impersonation and disguise
description: The art of the Ninja to empathize with other people and assume a new identity. Part of onshin jutsu.

title: Gogyō
description: View of nature adopted from Chinese Daoism. Water (Sui), Wood (moku), Fire (Ka), Earth (Do), and Metal (Kin).

title: Gogyō setsu
description: Short gogyō.

title: Gojō goyoku
description: Ninja strategy of manipulating people through their traits.

title: Goku no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Gorin no sho
description: Sword fighting and strategy work written by Miyamoto Musashi.

title: Goton pō
description: Ninja’s principle of escaping using the five elements of Gogyō.

title: Goton jutsu
description: Other name for goton pō.

title: Gyokko-ryū
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Gyokushin-ryū
translation: The School of the Jeweled Heart
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Gyorin
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Hagakure
description: Book by the Samurai Yamamoto Tsunetomo. Discusses the philosophical aspects of bushidō.

title: Ha jutsu
description: Rescue from grabs.

title: Hakama
description: Traditional Culottes.

title: Hanbō
description: The correct name is San shaku bō.

title: Hankyū
description: Ninja short bow. Sometimes collapsible. Easy to carry around.

title: Hanmi no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Hasami bune
description: Collapsible Ninja boat that allowed equipment to be transported across the water.

title: Hara
description: Denotes the entire area between the stomach and abdomen. Considered the center of mental and physical strength.

title: Hashigo
description: Also bashigo.

title: Hatsumi Masaaki
description: Birth name Hatsumi Yoshiaki, founder of the Bujinkan budō dōjō, sōke of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan and student of Takamatsu Toshitsugu. Respected worldwide person of honor.

title: Hattori Hanzo
description: Famous jōnin from the Iga region who is also a Samurai in the service of Tokugawa Ieyasu.

title: Hayes, Stephen K.
description: Teacher of Ninjutsu. Disciple of Hatsumi Masaaki. First non-Japanese to become shidoshi. Established Tōshindō as a school in the U.S.A.

title: Heipo
description: Ninja crawling method.

title: Heihō
description: Includes both combat methods and combat strategies (bōryaku).

title: Heike
description: Another name for the Taira.

title: Hensō jutsu
description: Art of Ninja disguise. Part of onshin jutsu.

title: Hichō no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Hira no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Hira shuriken
description: Flat throwing stars (shuriken) with different number of points, in different sizes and shapes.

title: Hiragana
description: Japanese syllabary, used for purely Japanese words. Invented by Kōbō Daishi.

title: Hishi
translation: Trapa japonica, water chestnut, crow’s foot
description: Dried water chestnuts that served the purpose of a tetsubishi.

title: Hiraki ashi
description: Sliding sideways with both feet.

title: Hito washi
description: Flying machine of the Ninja. Also yami doko.

title: Hōjō
description: Clan of risen Samurai. Were one of the families fighting for power in the sengoku jidai.

title: Hokkaidō
description: Northernmost island of Japan with capital Sapporo.

title: Hōko no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Hoshi
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Iaidō
description: Sport developed from Iai jutsu.

title: Iai jutsu
description: Art of the Samurai to kill an enemy with the first strike if possible.

title: Ichi no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Ichimonji no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Iga
description: Japanese province near Kyōto where the Ninja were particularly active.

title: Iga-ryū
description: Ninjutsu style, today’s Kumogakure ryū.

title: Iga Ueno
description: City in the Iga region that was once the center of the Ninja. Museums and festivals commemorate the achievements of the Ninja.

title: Iga dama
description: Stalkthistle (s. tetsubishi).

title: Igasaki Dojun
description: Famous Ninja from Iga province who got into an enemy castle using incredible tactics.

title: Ikkō-ikki
translation: Uprising of the Jodo Shinshu Buddhists
description: Revolt by the <q>League of Like-Minders</q>, an esoteric Buddhist sect.

title: In’yō
translation: Cosmic dual forces, yin and yang, sun and moon
description: The Japanese equivalent of yin and yang, the Taoist symbol of duality.

title: Inpō
description: The art of concealment and camouflage.

title: Inton jutsu
translation: The Ninja’s Art of Escaping and Hiding

title: Ippon sugi nobori
translation: A way of climbing a cedar
description: Device for climbing up a tree. A piece of iron with a hook, to which two ropes with handles are attached.

title: Ishikawa Goemon
description: Famous Ninja who used his art to steal. A sort of Japanese <q>Robin Hood</q>.

title: Jari bako
description: Vessels filled with rice, sand, or gravel, used to soften hands. Also kanshu.

title: Ji
description: Another name for Samurai.

title: Jitte
description: Hand weapon with a hook to absorb sword blows. Also jutte.

title: Jō
description: The full name is yon shaku bō.

title: Jōnin
description: Highest rank of the Ninja. Leader of a clan whose true identity was mostly known only to the chūnin. He gave the genin the necessary tasks. His strengths lay in the area of ​​politics, strategy and philosophy.

title: Jūjutsu
description: Ancient Japanese martial arts of the Samurai.

title: Jūdō
description: Japanese martial arts developed from jūjutsu by Professor Kanō Jigorō in 1882.

title: Jūmonji no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Jūnantaisō
description: Ninja agility and flexibility exercises.

title: Jū tai jutsu
description: Grab, lock and choke holds from taijutsu of Ninjutsu.

title: Jutte
description: Hand weapon with a hook to absorb sword blows. Also jitte.

title: Kagi nawa
description: Long rope with a hook attached to the end.

title: Kagi yari
description: Weapon of the Ninja that could deflect sword blows and climb trees. Also kama yari.

title: Ka jutsu
description: Handling fire, guns and explosives.

title: Kaku yoku
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Kama
description: Tool used throughout Asia to cut corn, rice, or sugar cane.

title: Kama ikada
description: One person raft made out of rushes.

title: Kama yari
description: Weapon of the Ninja that could deflect sword blows and climb trees. Also Kagi yari.

title: Kamikaze
description: Name for the two typhoons that the Mongolian forces under Kublai Khan destroyed. During World War II, the pilots who had to crash their planes on Allied ships and bases as a suicide squad were also called kamikaze.

title: Kamiza
description: The most important place in the dōjō, where pictures of the Grand Master hang and religious objects are displayed.

title: Kana
description: Japanese script. The Japanese script consists of a mixture of Japanese characters (katakana and hiragana) and Chinese characters (kanji ).

title: Kanshu
description: Vessels filled with rice, sand, or gravel, used to soften hands. Also jari bako.

title: Kanji
description: The characters were adopted by the Japanese and form a majority of their characters today.

title: Kantō kusha
description: Male Kunoichi Instructor.

title: Kanzashi
description: Hairpin made of wood or metal that has two prongs like a fork.

title: Karate dō
description: Martial arts that originated in Okinawa, an archipelago in southern Japan.

title: Kasha
description: Rappel pulley.

title: Kasugai
description: Hook the Ninja used to clip onto doors to prevent opening.

title: Kataga hasami bune
description: Small boat.

title: Katakana
description: Japanese syllabary alphabet, mainly used for foreign expressions, telegrams and onomatopoeia.

title: Katana
description: Long sword of the Samurai with a curved, single-edged blade. Blade length is between 61 and 76 cm. Belongs with the wakizashi to the daishō.

title: Katana kake
description: Used to store the katana around the house. The wakizashi was only put down when sleeping or in the bath, but even then it was always within reach.

title: Kato Danzo
description: Famous Ninja said to have been a master of jumping techniques.

title: Katon jutsu
description: Escape technique from goton pō, using fire as a means of escape.

title: Kaya kujutsu
translation: Art of handling fire and explosives

title: Kendō
description: Martial arts that evolved from the sword art (kenjutsu) of the Samurai. Today, a shinai is used instead of a sword. Armor is worn for protection.

title: Kenjutsu
description: Swordsmanship of Feudal Japan.

title: Kensei
description: A human who saw through the essence of the path and was considered almost invincible. Miyamoto Musashi is the best-known example of a kensei.

title: Kenshō
description: Understanding of all things, enlightenment, even satori.

title: Keri
description: Also Geri.

title: Kiai
description: Discharge energy in a battle cry. Should be accompanied by a powerful technique. Some masters have been able to kill small animals with the scream and temporarily paralyze humans.

title: Kiai jutsu
description: The art of using the kiai.

title: Kido Yazaemon
description: Famous Ninja who attempted an assassination attempt on Oda Nobunaga but failed.

title: Kinton jutsu
description: Escape technique from goton pō, using metal as a means of escape.

title: Kisha
description: Principle of gojō goyoku based on exploiting vanity.

title: Kito gan
description: Pill that quenched the Ninja’s thirst.

title: Kitsune gakure jutsu
translation: Art of hiding like a fox
description: Technique of hiding under the reeds like a fox.

title: Koashi
description: Ninja stride.

title: Kokizami ashi
description: Ninja stride.

title: Kōbō Daishi
description: Founder of the esoteric Buddhist sect of Shingon. Other name was Kūkai.

title: Kobudō
description: Weapons system developed on Okinawa, mostly using peasant tools as weapons.

title: Kōga-ryū
description: Ninjutsu style, most likely extinct today.

title: Kōgai
description: Needle attached to side wakizashi. Used as a tool for repairing leather items or for hoof care.

title: Kogakure
description: I chose this name for my website.

title: Kokū
description: Japanese measure of capacity for rice. In feudal Japan, people paid in kokū. One kokū is about 180 liters of rice.

title: Kokyūhō
description: Methods of Proper Breathing.

title: Komusō
description: Mendicant monk who belonged to the Fuke order. They traveled through Japan wearing a white kimono, a large hat that covered the whole face here, a sword (katana), a long walking staff, a fan, and a flute (shakuhachi). They were never allowed to remove their hats or speak in the presence of a non-monk. The sect has officially disappeared, but it may still exist in the underground.

title: Kongō
description: Short metal weapon used by Buddhist priests for self-defense. This scepter symbolizes the diamond, the sign of pure knowledge. Also known as Indra’s weapon.

title: Koppō jutsu
description: Bone-crushing techniques. In these techniques, the hands and feet have been strengthened through intense training to deliver devastating blows to the bones.

title: Koppō ken
translation: The Fist of the Bone Method

title: Kōsei no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Koshi jutsu
description: These techniques were performed against the muscles of the human body, causing severe pain.

title: Koto-ryū
translation: The School of Slaying the Tiger
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Koyaku
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Kū
description: Origin of subatomic energy, the nothingness, the beginning of all things.

title: Kubotan
description: Fist weapon shaped like a small cylinder. It can be used to apply pressure to joints.

title: Kuji in
description: The new finger signs (mudra) used by the Ninja.

title: Kuji kiri
description: Ritual of drawing a protective grid in the air with a symbolic sword. Not to be confused with kuji in.

title: Kūkai
description: Pseudonym for Kōbō Daishi.

title: Kukishinden-ryū
translation: The School of the Nine Demon Gods
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Kumade
description: Ninja weapon that could inflict terrible injuries. It was also used for climbing.

title: Kumawaka
description: Famous genin of the Kōga ryū who led 70 Ninja guerrillas.

title: Kumogakure-ryū
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Kunoichi
description: Female Ninja. Trained in hand-to-hand combat like their male counterparts, their main focus was manipulating the human psyche.

title: Kuroi Ōkami
description: Name of the Wolfsburg Bujinkan dōjō, directed by Shidoshi Mario Plückhahn.

title: Kusari fundō
description: Short chain with two weights on the ends.

title: Kusarigama
description: A Japanese sickle (kama) with a weighted chain (kusari) attached to it.

title: Ku shaku bō
description: Extra long (2.73 m) stick weapon.

title: Kyobako fune
description: A wooden box covered with leather on the outside.

title: Kyoketsu shoge
description: Favourite weapon of the Ninja. A knife with a hook, a four meter long rope attached to the handle and a steel ring at the end.

title: Kyōsha
description: Principle of gojō goyoku based on exploiting cowardice.

title: Kyōto
description: Ancient Japanese Imperial City.

title: Kyūjutsu
description: Samurai method of shooting with bows and arrows.

title: Kyūdō
description: Sport developed from the martial kyūjutsu.

title: Maai
description: Harmonic distance in time and space.

title: Mandala
description: Schematic representation of the universe in an image in tantra and mikkyō.

title: Manriki gusari
translation: A chain with the power of 10000
description: Chain with iron handles at the end.

title: Mantra
description: Tantrism and Mikkyō sounds.

title: Menkyo kaiden
description: Certificate of final mastery of a martial art. Given by the master to one or more students. Designates the owner as the legal heir of the style.

title: Metsubushi
description: Blend powder made from iron filings, sand, ash, or chemical substances that the Ninja could throw in the pursuer’s eyes during a pursuit.

title: Mikkyō
description: General term for various tantric teachings of Buddhism.

title: Minamoto
description: Name of a famous family (also Genji) that was at war with the Taira.

title: Miyamoto Musashi
description: Japan’s most famous swordsman. Traveled the country for many years to improve his sword skills. Won more than 60 fights during this time. He founded the Niten-ichi-ryū, a sword fighting school , in which you fought with two swords at the same time. Shortly before his death he wrote his book Gorin no Sho (The Book of the Five Rings).

title: Mizu taimatsu
description: Torch that burns even in the rain.

title: Mizugumo
description: Tool used by the Ninja to walk across swamplands.

title: Mochizuki Chiyome
description: Famous kunoichi who ran a network of kunoichi.

title: Mokuton jutsu
description: Escape technique from goton pō, using wood as a means of escape.

title: Mori
description: Clan of Samurai. Were one of the families fighting for power in the sengoku jidai.

title: Mudrā
description: Hand positions from tantra and mikkyō, from which nine characters were adopted in kuji in.

title: Mu
description: Also Bu.

title: Musha shūgyō
description: A method of teaching in which the warrior embarked on a long journey to improve himself. The adverse circumstances of such a journey formed the character and strengthened the spirit.

title: Musubi nawa
description: Horsehair rope.

title: Nagare
description: Principle of Softness.

title: Naginata
description: Sword Lance

title: Nagishi-shuriken
description: Throwing star (shuriken) with flight stabilization tassel on end.

title: Neko te
description: Pointed thimble. kunoichi weapon.

title: Nihon
description: Japan. Also nippon.

title: Nin
description: Also shinobu.

title: Ninja
description: Ninjutsu practitioner. Fighter, scout, spy, guerrilla and special agent of feudal medieval times.

title: Ninja ken
description: Also Ninja tō.

title: Ninja tō
description: Also Ninja ken.

title: Ninjutsu
description: Collective term for all ryū practiced by the Ninja. Very often involving unconventional fighting techniques and secret fighting techniques.

title: Ninpō
description: Ninjutsu as a way of life. Ninpō goes beyond the purely technical side and also teaches a spiritual path.

title: Ninpō inu bue
description: The art of Ninja training animals.

title: Ninpō mikkyō
description: The secret teachings of the Ninja based on the mikkyō.

title: Ninpō taijutsu
description: Unarmed Ninja combat. Also includes other physical aspects such as fall school.

title: Nin shokudai
description: L-shaped torch that could be hung.

title: Nippon
description: Japan. Also nihon.

title: Nishina Daisuke
description: Birth name of Togakure Daisuke, the founder of Togakure ryū.

title: Nodachi
description: Very long swords (1-1.80 m) of the Samurai, which were usually carried by a servant.

title: Nunchaku
description: A weapon from the Kobudō, consisting of two pieces of wood attached to each other with a short chain or cord. It is highly questionable whether a Ninja ever used this weapon.

title: Oda Nobunaga
description: Military dictator. Attempted to seize power in Japan in the sengoku jidai. Nobunaga was a ruthless general who occupied central Japan. He established a castle at Kyotō and used European firearms without hesitation. After his death, his generals succeeded in unifying Japan.

title: Ōgama
description: Much larger battlefield version of the kusarigama.

title: Okinawa
description: Group of islands in southern Japan.

title: Onibi
description: Used by the Ninja to terrify the enemy.

title: Oni kudaki
description: Leverage.

title: Ono gama
description: Combined weapon, battle ax and sickle.

title: Onshin jutsu
description: Art of the Ninja to hide, camouflage and render invisible.

title: Rakusha
description: Principle of gojō goyoku based on exploiting laziness.

title: Roku shaku bō
description: The most common form of bō. Roku means six and shaku is a Japanese measure. The roku shaku bō is about 1.82m.

title: Rōnin
description: When a Samurai lost his master (Daimyō), he was masterless and roamed the country. Some hired themselves out as mercenaries, others became martial arts teachers, some became robbers and plundered farmers.

title: Ryūha
translation: School of a specialty, stiles, tradition
description: Longer form of ryū.

title: Sai
description: Weapon from the kobudō.

title: Saichō
description: Pseudonym for Dengyō Daishi.

title: Saiga Magoichi
description: Famous Ninja who had special skills with firearms and explosives. His men were good snipers.

title: Sakki jutsu
translation: The art of guessing the ghost
description: Intuitive vision that allows the fighter to dodge a punch before it can be executed.

title: Saku
description: A battle formation from the bōryaku.

title: Samurai
description: Japanese warrior class.

title: Sanmyaku
description: Name of the official Bujinkan magazine.

title: Sansa jutsu
description: Ninja running techniques.

title: San shaku bō
description: Stick that is three shaku long, about 91 cm. Another name is hanbō.

title: Sashi ashi
description: Cross step.

title: Seii taishōgun
description: Initially the title of Commander-in-Chief of the Army, later shortened to shōgun.

title: Seiza no Kamae
description: Kneeling. Position (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Sekigahara
description: Small village in Mino province where Tokugawa Ieaysu achieved final victory over his enemies.

title: Senban
description: Four-pointed throwing star (shuriken).

title: Senban shaken
description: Throwing star (shuriken) with a hole in the middle.

title: Sengoku jidai
description: 1478-1577. Period of bloody civil wars in Japan.

title: Senjō jutsu
translation: The Art of the War Site
description: Maneuvering troops.

title: Senjutsu
description: War strategy.

title: Sensei
description: Teacher.

title: Shaken
description: Multi-Pronged Throwing Star (shuriken).

title: Shaku
description: Measurement of length. A shaku is 30.3 cm (10/33 meters).

title: Shakujō
description: Priest’s staff with rings attached to the end, which were supposed to scare critters off the path as they ran. This allowed the Buddhist monks to observe the principle of non-killing.

title: Shakuhachi
description: Flute played by the komusō, exactly one shaku long with eight side holes.

title: Shichi hō de
description: The seven traditional Ninja disguises.

title: Shidōshi
description: Teacher of the Art of Enlightenment

title: Shiken haramitsu daikomyō
description: Words spoken at the beginning of a training session. Very simplistic it means <q>We ask for protection and enlightenment</q>.

title: Shikomizue
description: Sword hidden in a staff.

title: Shikoro
description: Thin wood saw.

title: Shimabara no ran
description: Rebellion of the Christians 1637-1638 on the island of Shimabara, actually a peasant uprising, which was used to cause the persecution of Christians.

title: Shinai
description: A sword made from several pieces of bamboo tied together and held together with leather and cords and tightened. Used in kendo.

title: Shinbō
description: Fist weapon with middle finger ring.

title: Shinden-fudo-ryū
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Shingitai
description: One of the most important principles in martial arts.

title: Shinobi
translation: Sneak in, spy on, enter by stealth, condone
description: Abbreviation of Ninja.

title: Shingon
description: Buddhist sect founded by Kōbō Daishi.

title: Shinobi bune
description: Light, narrow boat.

title: Shinobi iri
description: Ninja techniques to move silently.

title: Shinobi kai
description: Paddle hidden in bamboo stick.

title: Shinobi katana
description: Sword of the Ninja.

title: Shinobi kenpō
description: Swordsmanship of the Ninja.

title: Shinobi no buki
description: The Weapons of the Ninja.

title: Shinobi no jutsu
description: Summary of the various arts of the Ninja under one heading.

title: Shinobi shobō
description: Handgun.

title: Shinobi shōzoku
description: Dark combat suit of the Ninja. Light gray or white in winter.

title: Shinobi tantō
description: Dagger (Tantō) concealed in a staff.

title: Shinobi zue
description: Hollow bamboo staff containing hidden weapons or blinding powder.

title: Shinobi jutsu
description: Summary of the various arts of the Ninja under one heading.

title: Shinobu
translation: perseverance, forbearance, patience, self-control, endure, conceal, spy, sneak

title: Shintō
description: Japanese religion that sees higher spirits in all manifestations.

title: Shishi undō
description: Motion of arms and legs.

title: Shizen no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Shizentai
description: Relaxed, natural position.

title: Shizen ken
description: Natural weapons of the body like shoulder, bodyweight, nails etc.

title: Shōten no jutsu
translation: The art of soaring into the sky

title: Shobō
description: Handgun.

title: Shōgun
description: Japanese military commander.

title: Shōtoku Taishi
description: Prince Regent (572-622). Said to have first used agents to learn the truth about disputes.

title: Shugendō
translation: The way to test yourself well
description: Esoteric teaching and ascetic form practiced primarily by the yamabushi.

title: Shukō
description: Also Tekagi.

title: Shuriken
description: Ninja projectiles. They came in all shapes and sizes.

title: Sodezutsu
description: Hand cannon.

title: Sōhei
description: Warrior monks and mercenaries employed by monasteries.

title: Sōke
description: Head of a ryū.

title: Sugitani Zenjubo
description: Famous Ninja who assassinated Oda Nobunaga on May 19, 1570, but the two bullets only hit his shoulder poster.

title: Suiren
description: Stopping and moving underwater.

title: Suitonjutsu
description: Escape technique from goton pō, using water as a means of escape.

title: Tabi
description: Japanese toe socks. The big toe is separated from the other toes.

title: Tachi
description: Sword similar to katana, usually more curved and carried on the battlefield. Ceremonially decorated and very elaborately crafted.

title: Tai sabaki
description: Trunk movement.

title: Taihen jutsu
description: Part of taijutsu, stances, postures, movements and falling techniques.

title: Taijutsu
description: Term for unarmed combat.

title: Taikai
description: Competition of fighters at events.

title: Taira
description: Name of a famous family (also Heike) that was at war with the Minamoto.

title: Takagi-yōshin-ryū
translation: The School of the High Tree Willow Spirit
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Takamatsu Toshitsugu
description: Teacher of various Ninjutsu styles, master of Hatsumi Masaaki. One of the last true warriors. The collection of nine ryū is named Bujinkan in his honour.

title: Takeda Shingen
description: Famous general (Daimyō) who fought a series of wars in sengoku jidai.

title: Tanagoko
description: Palm Torch.

title: Tantō
description: Dagger.

title: Tantra
description: Stream within Indian philosophy and religion, originally an esoteric form of Hinduism, later transferred to Tibetan Buddhism.

title: Tanuki gakure
description: Ninja climbing technique for scaling trees and poles and hiding in high places.

title: Taru ikada
description: Aquatic tool of the Ninja, consisting of two barrels in which you could put your feet and use a paddle to move across water surfaces. Also uki daru.

title: Tatami
description: In Japan, these are used as floor coverings in houses or in dōjō.

title: Tebukuro
description: The Ninja used this garment to cover his arms and hands.

title: Tekagi
description: Also shukō.

title: Tekken
description: Brass knuckles. Also tekkō.

title: Tekkō
description: Brass knuckles. Also Tekken.

title: Tendai
description: Esoteric mikkyō Buddhist sect founded by Dengyō Daishi. Its center was on Hiei zan in Enryakuji Monastery.

title: Tengū
description: Mythical creatures from Japanese history. There are tengū with wings (ko tengū), with raven’s beaks (karasu tengū) or with long noses (konsha tengū). They were considered philanthropic, but sometimes devious and lived in the mountains. They are said to have been masters of the martial arts and are often regarded as teachers of a style.

title: Tennō
description: Japanese Emperor.

title: Tenugui
description: Cotton cloth used by the Ninja to make their mask.

title: Tetsubishi
description: Safflowers, which the Ninja threw on the ground in large numbers to prevent an opponent from pursuing.

title: Tōami
description: The Ninja could use it to trap his opponents.

title: Tobi ashi
description: Ninja stride.

title: Tobi bashigo
description: Ladder with hooks on the ends that could be thrown.

title: Tobikunai
description: Tool for opening locked gates.

title: Toda Shinryūken Masamitsu
description: Ninja master who was Takamatsu Toshitsugu’s teacher.

title: Togakure Daisuke
description: Founder of the Togakure ryū who fled to the Iga region after losing a battle.

title: Togakure-ryū
description: One of the nine ryū of the Bujinkan.

title: Tōiri
description: Strategy executed by the Ninja during peacetime, pre-emptively and primarily involving espionage.

title: Tokugawa Ieyasu
description: Famous Daimyō who was allied with Oda Nobunaga. After the end of the sengoku jidai, he proclaimed himself shogun. His family ruled until 1868.

title: Tōkyō
description: Capital of Japan with 12 million inhabitants. Old name of the city was Edo.

title: Tonki
description: Throwable missiles.

title: Torinawa
description: Weapon of the Ninja consisting of a rope with a weight and a spike. It is used for entrapment and restraint.

title: Tori no ko
description: Firecrackers.

title: Toyotomi Hideyoshi
description: Japanese daimyo who was of non-noble descent. He was a general in Oda Nobunaga’s service. After his death, he unified Japan, but was betrayed by Tokugawa Ieyasu and his entire family was wiped out.

title: Tsuba
description: Attached to the sword, it protected the hand from sword blows.

title: Tsubo giri
description: Drills for larger holes.

title: Tsugi bune
description: Boat made of parts.

title: Uchi
description: Stroke technique.

title: Uchi dake
description: Bamboo container for embers. With this tool, the Ninja was able to create fire quickly.

title: Uesugi Kenshin
description: Japanese Daimyō who attempted to seize power in Japan during the sengoku jidai. Uesugi is reported to have died when he was in the private room. A Ninja waiting in the privy shaft is said to have killed him.

title: Uki daru
description: Aquatic tool of the Ninja consisting of two barrels into which you could put your feet and use a paddle to move across water surfaces. Also taru ikada.

title: Uzume bi
description: Landmines.

title: Wakizashi
description: Samurai short sword. Used together with the katana for the daishō.

title: Wakizashi teppō
description: Concealed within a traditional short sword was a pistol that could fire one shot.

title: Wakō
description: Japanese pirates who wreaked havoc in the Pacific. Hardly any shōgun could match their superiority. Many inventive weapons of the Ninja go back to the wakō.

title: Wari ashi
description: Ninja stride.

title: Yamabushi
description: Reclusive mountain hermits who followed shugendō philosophy.

title: Yajiri
description: Powerful saw. Tool of the Ninja.

title: Yamidoko
description: Ninja aircraft. Also hito washi.

title: Yang
description: Das positive Prinzip der Dualität Yin/Yang aus dem Daoismus. Die japanische Bezeichnung ist <q>yō</q>.

title: Yawara
description: Handgun.

title: Yin
description: The negative principle of yin/yang duality from Daoism. The Japanese term is <q>in</q>.

title: Yinyang
description: The duality of light and shadow, good and evil, small and large. An important principle of Daoism. The Japanese term is <q>in</q>/<q>yō</q>.

title: Yoga
description: Indian body and spirit teachings, which includes a large number of subspecies. Each <q>path to enlightenment</q> in India is a <q>yoga path</q>. Through one of them - hatha yoga one achieves that the body in able to bend into incredible positions. Others include diet, meditation, and breathing.

title: Yuki waraki
description: Also Geta.

title: Yon shaku bō
description: Stick that is four shaku long, about 1.21 m. Another name is jō.

title: Zazen
description: Remaining in a state of thoughtless, wide-awake awareness. Your thoughts are not focused on anything. This type of Buddhism dates back to the meditation of the Buddha before his awakening.

title: Atemite
translation: Hit the body with the hand
description: Another term for hitting the vital points and nerve centers.

title: Han
description: The fief of a Daimyō.

title: Dōkyō
description: Chinese philosophical doctrine that is often mistakenly confused with the Taoist religion. Taoism teaches an approach to nature and an understanding of the universe.

title: Ninpō ikkan
translation: Ninjutsu is the beginning and has no end

title: Ukemi gata taihen jutsu
translation: The Art of Rolling and Falling

title: Hira no kamae
description: Posture (kamae) from Ninjutsu.

title: Shihō tenchi tobi
translation: Jump in four directions, towards the sky and towards the earth

title: Shōten jutsu
translation: The art of soaring into the sky
